Spring Release

2013 was an incredible vintage— some say Napa’s vintage of the century— but for me it marks an important milestone in my personal journey. This year was my 10th year as a winemaker. Since the start, each vintage has its own challenges- mother nature throws you curve balls—you try new things, make mistakes, do your best, and carry on to the next year, only to find a whole new set of challenges. Not often are you gifted an ideal growing season. If it had been given to me in my first year as a winemaker, I would have surely wasted the opportunity. But several years later, my experience and intuition caught up with my ambition, and I was able to craft wines that are truly special to me. When an optimal growing season presents itself, it’s not an opportunity to sit back and watch as mother nature does the work for you, but a chance to use all you have learned to harness the true potential of the fruit.

The Fait-Main 2013 Beckstoffer Las Piedras Cabernet Sauvignon is rich and dense, with mineral accents and a full-bodied opulence that explodes with dark fruit. The 2013 Bettinelli Sleeping Lady Cabernet Sauvignon has captivating vibrancy with bright fruit, a sweet floral nose, and an undercurrent of unsmoked cigar tobacco.

In addition to these wines, I will be offering the 2014 Toyon Farm Chardonnay—a racy, Burgundian-style Chardonnay from Carneros.

This is the first time I have ever released all of the Fait-Main wines at once. The ultimate purpose of all of my work is for these wines to be shared and enjoyed, and I feel privileged that you have chosen to be a part of the journey with me.

Amitiés,
